tuv.seg: Buying a new car
Carr nua a cheannach in Éirinn
Generally, all new cars and cars that are imported into Ireland are subject to Vehicle Registration Tax (VRT) and must be registered with Revenue
Go ginearálta, bíonn gach carr nua agus cairr a iompórtáiltear isteach go hÉirinn faoi réir Cáin Chláraithe Feithiclí (CCF) agus ní mór iad a chlárú leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
Before you can drive your car in a public place you must also:
Sula dtiomáineann tú do charr in áit phoiblí, is gá duit an méid a leanas a dhéanamh:
• Have vehicle registration plates
• Plátaí clárúcháin feithicle a bheith agat
• Have paid motor tax
• Mótarcháin a bheith íoctha agat
This document explains what is involved in buying a new car in Ireland from a dealer or a garage
Mínítear sa cháipéis seo céard atá i gceist le carr nua a cheannach in Éirinn ó dhéileálaí nó ó gharáiste
In other documents you will find information on:
I gcáipéisí eile, tiocfaidh tú ar fhaisnéis ar an méid a leanas:
• Buying a used car
• Carr athláimhe a cheannach
• Importing a new or used car
• Carr nua nó athláimhe a iompórtáil
There is also a consumer guide to buying a car
Tá Comhairle maidir le carr nua a cheannach ar fáil chomh maith
Since July 2008, a labelling system allows consumers to compare the carbon (CO2) emissions of new cars
Ó Iúil 2008, ceadaíonn córas lipéadaithe do thomhaltóirí astuithe carbóin (CO2) a bhíonn ag carranna nua a chur i gcomparáid
The first section of the label shows the emission bands and identifies the band for the particular vehicle to which a label is attached
Taispeánann an chéad chuid den lipéad na bandaí astuithe agus sainaithníonn sé an banda don fheithicil ar leith a bhfuil lipéad ceangailte leis
The second section of the label provides three important points of information for consumers:
Soláthraítear sa dara cuid den lipéad trí phointe thábhachtacha d’fhaisnéis do thomhaltóirí:
• The amount of fuel required to run the vehicle over 18,000 kilometres
• An méid breosla a theastaíonn chun an fheithicil a thiomáint thar fhad 18,000 ciliméadar
• The annual motor tax payable
• An mhótarcháin bhliantúil atá iníoctha
• The rate of VRT payable on the vehicle
• An ráta CCF atá iníoctha ar an bhfeithicil
The third section of the label supplements the information provided in the first and second sections, and introduces the importance of driving behaviour
Cuirtear sa tríú cuid den lipéad leis an bhfaisnéis a sholáthraítear sa chéad agus sa dara cuid, agus leagtar béim ar an tábhacht a bhaineann le hiompar tiomána
The remaining sections of the label provide essential information on the actual vehicle to which it is attached, including make, model, engine capacity, transmission, fuel type and consumption

Soláthraítear sna codanna eile den lipéad faisnéis ríthábhachtach ar an bhfeithicil féin lena bhfuil sé ceangailte, lena n-áirítear déanamh, samhail, toilleadh innill, tras-seoladh, saghas an bhreosla agus úsáid breosla
An example of a label is available here (pdf)
Tá fáil ar shampla de lipéad anseo (pdf)
Buying from a car dealer
Carr a cheannach ó dhéileálaí
When you buy your new car from a dealer (for example, car showrooms), it is the dealer's responsibility to register the vehicle and pay the required tax before giving it to you

Nuair a cheannaíonn tú do charr nua ó dhéileálaí (mar shampla, seomra taispeántais charranna), tá an fhreagracht ar an déileálaí an fheithicil a chlárú agus an cháin riachtanach a íoc sula dtugtar an carr duit
Every new car is liable for Vehicle Registration Tax (VRT), which is payable when the car is first registered
Tá Cáin Chláraithe Feithiclí (CCF) le híoc ar gach carr nua, atá iníoctha nuair a chláraítear an carr den chéad uair
The price of the vehicle should include the cost of VRT
Ba chóir don chostas CCF a bheith san áireamh i bpraghas na feithicle
There is more information on VRT in our document on importing a car
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar fáil ar CCF inár gcáipéis faoi ghluaisteán a iompórtáil
Once the vehicle has been registered and the VRT paid, your car dealer will receive:
Chomh luath agus atá an fheithicil cláraithe agus an CCF íoctha, gheobhaidh do dhéileálaí carranna:
• A receipt for the VRT paid showing the registration number assigned to your car
• Admháil don CCF íoctha a léiríonn an uimhir chlárúcháin atá sannta do do charr
• A Form RF 100 for use when you are applying for motor tax (see below)
• Foirm RF 100 le húsáid nuair atá iarratas á dhéanamh ar mhótarcháin (féach thíos)
Vehicle registration plates showing the assigned registration number must be displayed on your car within 3 days of the date of registration
Ní mór plátaí clárúcháin feithicle a léiríonn an uimhir chlárúcháin sannta a bheith le feiceáil ar do charr laistigh de 3 lá ón dáta clárúcháin
The dealer should have the registration plates fitted by the time you take possession of it
Ba cheart go mbeadh na plátaí clárúcháin feistithe ag an déileálaí faoin am a ghlacann tú seilbh air
The vehicle registration certificate for your car is issued by the Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport
Eisíonn an Roinn Iompair, Turasóireachta agus Spóirt deimhniú clárúcháin i gcomhair do chairr
This will be posted out to you after you have applied to your local motor tax office to pay motor tax on your vehicle
Seolfar é seo sa phost chugat tar éis duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar an oifig mótarchánach áitiúil le mótarcháin na feithicle a íoc
It is a legal requirement to have motor insurance and to display the insurance disc on the windscreen, if you want to drive your car in a public place
Is ceanglas dlíthiúil mótarárachas a bheith agat agus an diosca árachais a thaispeáint ar an ngaothscáth, má theastaíonn uait do charr a thiomáint in áit phoiblí
You will need your motor insurance details when applying for motor tax
Beidh do shonraí mótarárachais ag teastáil uait nuair a bhíonn iarratas á dhéanamh agat ar mhótarcháin
Read more about the requirement for motor insurance here
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi cheanglas an mhótarárachais anseo
Motor tax is a charge imposed by the Government on motor vehicles
Is muirear í mótarcháin a ghearrann an Rialtas ar mhótharfheithiclí
Not only must you pay motor tax if you want to drive your car in a public place, but you are also required to display evidence that you have paid (that is, a current tax disc) on the windscreen

Ní hamháin gur gá duit mótarcháin a íoc más mian leat do charr a thiomáint in áit phoiblí, ach ceanglaítear ort fianaise a thaispeáint gur íoc tú aisti (is é sin, diosca reatha cánach) ar an ngaothscáth
The charge for motor tax for a new car is based on the car's CO2 emissions and on engine size for other vehicles
Is ar astuithe CO2 an chairr a shocraítear an muirear mótarchánach i gcomhair cairr nua agus is ar thoilleadh an innill a shocraítear é i gcás feithiclí eile
Some vehicles are exempt
Tá roinnt feithiclí díolmhaithe
Read more about the requirement for motor tax here
Is féidir leat tuilleadh a léamh faoi cheanglas na mótarchánach anseo
Tax reliefs and exemptions
Faoisimh agus díolúintí cánach
There are different reliefs and exemptions from VRT and further information is available on Revenue’s website
Tá faoisimh agus díolúintí difriúla ó CCF ar fáil agus tá tuilleadh faisnéise le fáil ar láithreán gréasáin na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim
Tax relief is also available under the Disabled Drivers and Disabled Passengers Scheme
Tá faoiseamh cánach ar fáil, chomh maith, faoi Scéim na dTiománaithe agus na bPaisinéirí faoi Mhíchumas
Electric vehicles grant scheme
Scéim deontais na bhfeithiclí leictreacha
A grant scheme is available for battery-powered electric vehicles (BEV) and plug-in hybrids meeting specific standards
Tá fáil ar scéim deontais le haghaidh feithiclí leictreacha faoi chumhacht chadhnraí
The grant level applicable depends on the List Price of the vehicle
Braitheann leibhéal an deontais atá infheidhme ar Liostphraghas na feithicle
The maximum grant is €5,000
Is é €5,000 an deontas uasta
There is no grant for vehicles with a List Price of less than €14,000
Níl aon deontas le fáil d’fheithiclí ar a bhfuil Liostphraghas níos lú ná €14,000
The grant is provided to the dealer and the benefit is passed on to you as a price reduction on the vehicle
Soláthraítear an deontas don déileálaí agus bainfidh tú féin tairbhe as mar laghdú praghais ar an bhfeithicil
Further information on the grant scheme is available on the website of the Sustainable Energy Authority of Ireland (SEAI)
Tá fáil ar thuilleadh faisnéise ar an scéim deontais ar láithreán gréasáin Údarás Fuinnimh Inmharthana na hÉireann (ÚFIÉ)
